params.taskDescription:
The _____ ___ __________ is a valid logical argument with premises, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p \to q</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>p</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">p</annotation></semantics></math>, used to support the conclusion, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">q.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
The chain rule for conditional arguments states that the ___________________ property applies to conditional arguments, so that: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi>p</mi>
      <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
      <mi>q</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi>q</mi>
      <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
      <mi>r</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi>p</mi>
      <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
      <mi>r</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\left( {p \to q} \right) \wedge \left( {q \to r} \right) \to \left( {p \to r} \right).</annotation></semantics></math>
